alert.note: Alert for Coshocton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 8:22PM EST until January 04 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC031-021330- /O.NEW.KPBZ.FL.W.0001.220102T1120Z-220105T0200Z/ /CSHO1.1.ER.220102T1120Z.220103T0000Z.220104T2000Z.NO/ 822 PM EST Sat Jan 1 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River At Coshocton. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, water reaches low lying areas between Tuscarawas and Walhonding Rivers just upstream of the confluence of the two rivers. At 15.0 feet, low areas are flooded and water reaches a few homes along Route 16 south of Coshocton and along County Route 1A north of Coshocton. At 16.0 feet, flood waters begin to affect the Lake Park area along the Walhonding River and begins backwater flooding along Mill Creek north of Lake Park and along Route 83. Flood waters will begin to enter yards in low-lying areas along County Route 1A. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 15.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
